properties.name: A summer trip, when I was younger.
properties.description: Posted by TommywhitewolfSome of the Garrisi family was located here and I went with my Mom & Dad here one summer on vacation.

properties.name: Could this be our next place ? ? ?
properties.description: Posted by Tommywhitewolf

properties.name: Finding my Roots.
properties.description: Posted by TommywhitewolfOn November 14,1998, thanks to the help of my wonderful wife and kids, I found my oldest brother after 44 years of being seperated. I also found the rest of my family, two sisters (Nancy and Judy) and another brother (Bill).There was also my brother Bobby (WD9EPR) who passed away some six years ago.

properties.name: Home for my Big Sis
properties.description: Posted by TommywhitewolfThis is where my "Big" sis Nan lives with her husband Gene. Maybe someday soon, we will live a little closer and be able to visit more often.

properties.name: Home for my neice Betty
properties.description: Posted by TommywhitewolfIn July of 2006, I met my neice Betty and her son Matthew for the first time. They live here in Bend, OR. We walked, talked, watched fireworks, and I got to know her and some more about her dad (my brother, Bob).

properties.name: Home in Prescott Valley
properties.description: Posted by TommywhitewolfThe other day, Pam and I were talking and it occurred to us that "home" for us just seems to be, "where ever we are, as long as it\'s together".

properties.name: Home to my Big Lil' Sis
properties.description: Posted by TommywhitewolfFox Lake, IL is where my sister Judy lives. She never gave up hope that we would be re-united one day. Perhaps someday soon, we will live a little bit closer to making visiting an easier thing to do.

properties.name: Home to my Brother Bill
properties.description: Posted by TommywhitewolfMy remaining older brother Bill lives in Pensylvania. Someday, I will get to meet him and give him a hug from his Lil\' Bro\'.

properties.name: Las Vegas, NV
properties.description: Posted by TommywhitewolfI attended a seminar here for two days and we walked our feet off taking in the sights and sounds that can provide one with what I call, Sensory Overload. We don\'t gamble but dropped a few coins into the slots.

properties.name: My oldest Son Bob's place.
properties.description: Posted by TommywhitewolfHere is where my oldest son lives with all my beautiful grandsons. Someday soon (I hope) we will be living closer and will be able to visit them alot more often. 2,200 miles away is too far. But don\'t tell him because I would just like to pop in for coffee some day. hehehe

properties.name: Or maybe this could be the next place !?!
properties.description: Posted by Tommywhitewolf

properties.name: Our 2006 summer vacation
properties.description: Posted by TommywhitewolfSan Francisco is too crowded for me and Pam, but we had a fabulous time walking down around Fisherman\'s Warf and seeing the Golden Gate bridge. It was truly spectacular.

properties.name: Our Favorite coffe spot in Sedona
properties.description: Posted by TommywhitewolfYou have to see Sedona to understand it\'s beauty and charm. It is truly a wonderful place.

properties.name: Prescott, AZ
properties.description: Posted by TommywhitewolfWe lived here for about a year and a half when we first arrived in Arizona.

properties.name: Summer of 1967
properties.description: Posted by TommywhitewolfIn the summer of 1967 I spent almost two months at this location with the Capucian order of Priests and Brothers teaching (and learning) from my students. It was here, where I was given the name of Tommy Whitewolf. A name that I cherish and keep.

properties.name: TC was home for almost 18 years.
properties.description: Posted by Tommywhitewolftraverse City, MI

properties.name: This is where my Big Bro' lives
properties.description: Posted by TommywhitewolfMy oldest brother Frank and his wife Marge live here in Thompsonville, IL. Perhaps one day soon, we well live closer and be able to visit more frequently.

properties.name: This location is in error
properties.description: Posted by TommywhitewolfI can\'t seem to delete it - but the location is actually in Montana. Sorry about that!!

properties.name: Where I grew up
properties.description: Posted by Tommywhitewolf

properties.name: Where I spent my Homeymoon.
properties.description: Posted by TommywhitewolfIn 1974, I married Pam and we spent our honeymoon in Lorraine, Ohio where her mother and step-dad lived. That was how it started, walking the shores of Lake Erie and still looking for sea shells 3 decades later.
